etymologies: mid 17th century (in arabesque (sense 2)): from French, from Italian arabesco ‘in the Arabic style’, from arabo ‘Arab’. arabesque (sense 1) and arabesque (sense 3) date from the early 19th century

definitions: a posture in which one leg is extended backwards at right angles, the torso bent forwards, and the arms outstretched, one forwards and one backwards.
shortDefinitions: posture in which one leg is extended backwards at right angles

definitions: an ornamental design consisting of intertwined flowing lines, originally found in ancient Islamic art

examples.text: she had embellished the symbols with lovely loops, arabesques, and curlicues

shortDefinitions: ornamental design consisting of intertwined flowing lines

definitions: a passage or composition with fanciful ornamentation of the melody.
shortDefinitions: passage or composition with fanciful ornamentation of melody
